byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

abstract: Obama administration moves to ban manufacture and sale of popular, armor-piercing bullets for the AR-15 semiautomatic rifle, citing threat to police posed by its use in new handguns; move by Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives enrages gun-rights advocates and spurs urgent response from the National Rifle Assn; dealers report surge of interest in ammunition ahead of ban.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has proposed banning the manufacture and sale of a popular bullet used in AR-15 semiautomatic rifles, a move that has enraged gun rights advocates.

headline.main: Move to Ban a Bullet Adds to Its Appeal
headline.print_headline: Move to Ban a Bullet Adds to Its Appeal

snippet: The Obama administration has proposed banning the manufacture and sale of a popular bullet used in AR-15 semiautomatic rifles, a move that has enraged gun rights advocates.

keywords.value: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms
